jobDescription: To provide our clients with exceptional service in a timely and professional manner, and in accordance with HUBs operating procedure.  Responsibilities as an Assistant Account Executive, include: Working with the team leader to service a dedicated book of business;Account review, gathering information, research,marketing submissions, invoicing, policy checking, and all other matters related thereto, except the direct handling of claims and loss control;Working with team leaders/ team to service overall team book of business, which is not directly assigned to the position, but is part of the team;Responsibilityfor identifying exposures on the accounts , and for discussing with the team leader and/or the client;Ability to access exposures, and make coverage recommendations, written and oral;Ability to review losses, and determine loss trends, and make recommendations on loss control in tandem with the loss control department;Assist andcoordinate the delivery of services between our clients, carriers andloss control departments;Communicate effectively, timely, with team leader and all co-workers;Invoice all renewals and policy change requests timely;Process all cancellations including updating policy billing screen and invoicing;Process all renewals/change requests/cancellations as needed;Close out activities of account managers when processing is completed.Keeping activities current and update to date;Send policies to history and make clients inactive, when appropriate;Enter all appropriate activities in the system in conjunction with processing;Make calls to companies when there are problems/questions pertaining to processing;Assists in maintaining expiration reports;Proficiency in accessing all company systems/websites to obtain all necessary information in the processing procedures;Ability to write letters and emails that are accurate, concise and to the point;Perform other miscellaneous duties and projects as assigned;Follow and adhere to all company protocols.
